result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Ryan Christensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. Bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owig is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendat of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he must provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge; his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

Defendant Patrick Ryan Christensen in court with attorney Benjamin T Van Severen.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 1/2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 3 days served.  Court ordered 1 1/2 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent with  any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 3 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/05/14.
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
